title: Patton
oscars_won_details: Best Actor in a Leading Role
Best Writing, Story and Screenplay Based on Factual Material or Material Not Previously Published or Produced
description: The biography of the controversial World War II hero General George S. Patton, covering his wartime activities and accomplishments.

title: M*A*S*H
oscars_won_details: Best Writing, Screenplay Based on Material from Another Medium
description: The staff of a Korean War field hospital use humor and high jinks to keep their sanity in the face of the horror of war.

title: Five Easy Pieces
description: A dropout from an upper-class family picks up work along the way to oil rigs when his life begins to get uncomfortable.

title: Little Big Man
description: Jack Crabb, looking back from his extreme old age, tells of his life being raised by Native Americans and fighting with General Custer.

title: Woodstock
description: Chronicle of the legendary 1969 music festival which attracted half a million people to a farm in upstate New York.

title: Le Cercle Rouge
description: After leaving prison, a master thief encounters a notorious escapee and an ex-cop, and together they plot a jewel heist.

title: The Conformist
description: A weak-willed Italian man becomes a fascist flunky who goes abroad to arrange the assassination of his old teacher, now a political dissident.

title: Tora! Tora! Tora!
description: A dramatization of the Japanese attack on Pearl Harbor and the series of American blunders that allowed it to happen.

title: Kelly's Heroes
description: A group of U.S. soldiers sneaks across enemy lines to get their hands on a secret stash of Nazi treasure.

title: The Aristocats
description: With the help of a smooth talking tomcat, a family of Parisian felines set to inherit a fortune from their owner try to make it back home after a jealous butler kidnaps them and leaves them in the country.

title: El Topo
description: A mysterious black-clad gunfighter wanders a mystical Western landscape encountering a series of bizarre characters.

title: Love Story
description: A boy and a girl from different backgrounds fall in love regardless of their upbringing - and then tragedy strikes.

title: Airport
oscars_won_details: Best Actress in a Supporting Role
description: A bomber on board an airplane, an airport closed by snow, and various personal problems of the people involved.

title: The Bird with the Crystal Plumage
description: An American expatriate in Rome witnesses an attempted murder that is connected to an ongoing killing spree in the city, and conducts his own investigation despite himself and his girlfriend being targeted by the killer.

title: Investigation of a Citizen Above Suspicion
description: A police inspector kills his mistress and plants clues to prove his own guilt.

title: Ryan's Daughter
oscars_won_details: Best Actor in a Supporting Role
description: Set in the wake of the 1916 Easter Rising, a married woman in a small Irish village has an affair with a troubled British officer.

title: The Private Life of Sherlock Holmes
description: Sherlock Holmes and Dr. Watson investigate the disappearance of a woman's engineer husband, leading them to Loch Ness and a secret submarine.

title: Tristana
description: After her mother dies, a young woman goes to live with her guardian, an aristocrat who eventually treats her as a wife as well as a daughter.

title: The Wild Child
description: In 1798, a feral boy is discovered in the woods of Aveyron, France. A doctor attempts to civilize him and educate him.

title: Claire's Knee
description: On holiday at Lake Annecy, a diplomat accepts a bet to flirt with two teenage stepsisters, but ends up fixated on the knee of one of them.

title: Bed and Board
description: Antoine Doinel and Christine Darbon are married and running a flower business, but Antoine's immaturity and an affair threaten their relationship.

title: Dodes'ka-den
description: A collection of stories about the lives of the residents of a Tokyo slum.

title: Performance
description: A violent gangster needing a sanctuary finds it in the home of a reclusive rock star.

title: Gimme Shelter
description: A documentary chronicling the last weeks of the Rolling Stones' 1969 US tour which culminated in the disastrous Altamont Free Concert.

title: Wanda
description: A lonely, simple housewife drifts through life and ends up traveling with a petty thief.

title: The Railway Children
description: After their father is enforcedly taken away, three children move to a house near a railway line and occupy themselves with watching the trains and helping others.

title: Waterloo
description: Facing the decline of his power and the legacy of his genius, Napoleon Bonaparte meets the Duke of Wellington in the Battle of Waterloo.

title: Cromwell
description: Disgusted with King Charles I's policies, Oliver Cromwell plans to take his family to the New World. But on the eve of their departure, he is drawn into the English Civil War.

title: The Ballad of Cable Hogue
description: A prospector is abandoned in the desert by his partners, finds water where it isn't supposed to be, and turns the water hole into a thriving business while waiting for revenge.

title: Two Mules for Sister Sara
description: A drifting mercenary rescues a nun from a gang of bandits and they team up to help Mexican revolutionaries.

title: Colossus: The Forbin Project
description: Thinking machines take over the world when the US and USSR supercomputers link up.

title: The Boys in the Band
description: Tempers fray and true selves are revealed when a heterosexual man accidentally attends a gay birthday party.

title: Catch-22
description: A man is trying desperately to be certified insane during World War II, so he can stop flying missions.

title: Scrooge
description: A musical retelling of Charles Dickens' classic novel about an old bitter miser taken on a journey of self-redemption, courtesy of several mysterious Christmas apparitions.

title: The Twelve Chairs
description: A fallen aristocrat, a priest and a con artist search for a treasure of jewels hidden inside one of twelve dining chairs, lost during the Russian Revolution.

title: King Lear
description: A Russian adaptation of Shakespeare's tragedy about an aging king who divides his kingdom between two of his daughters.

title: Deep End
description: A 15-year-old takes a job in a run-down public bathhouse and becomes obsessed with a female colleague.

title: Valerie and Her Week of Wonders
description: A girl on the verge of womanhood finds herself in a sensual fantasia of vampires, witchcraft, and other threats in this surreal fairytale.

title: Multiple Maniacs
description: Lady Divine's Cavalcade of Perversion is a traveling show of freaks and kinks, but Divine is actually a thief and murderer.

title: The Spider's Stratagem
description: A man visits the town where his father, an anti-fascist hero, was murdered, only to discover the truth about his father's death.

title: Even Dwarfs Started Small
description: The inmates of an institution for little people revolt against the director and take over the asylum.

title: The Ear
description: A Czechoslovak official and his wife return home from a political function to find their house bugged and their movements monitored.

title: Husbands
description: A common friend's sudden death brings three men, married with children, together for a frenetic spree of drinking, gambling and philandering.

title: Brewster McCloud
description: An introverted loner living in the bowels of the Houston Astrodome builds a pair of wings to fly.

title: The Garden of the Finzi-Continis
description: In 1938 Ferrara, Italy, the Finzi-Continis are a wealthy Jewish family who believe their high social standing will protect them from Mussolini's anti-Semitic edicts.

title: Zabriskie Point
description: An undergraduate student and a young woman meet in Death Valley and have a romance amid the counterculture movement of the late 1960s.

title: The Honeymoon Killers
description: A lonely nurse answers a personal ad from a gigolo and they begin a crime spree where they rob and murder single women.

title: I Never Sang for My Father
description: A widowed college professor wants to change his life, but finds it difficult to sever the ties with his domineering father.

title: Monte Walsh
description: An aging cowboy realizes that the West he knew and loved is disappearing and that there is no room for him anymore.

title: They Call Me Trinity
description: A lazy gunfighter and his brother defend a Mormon settlement from a land-grabbing Major and a Mexican bandit.

title: The Molly Maguires
description: A Pinkerton detective infiltrates a secret society of Irish coal miners in Pennsylvania in 1876 to expose their leader.

title: Donkey Skin
description: A king wishes to marry his daughter, but she escapes his kingdom wearing the skin of a donkey and hides in a nearby village.
